title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Youth Opportunities Unlimited (Strathroy, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Over all the interview process was very smooth. The interviewers asked their questions, and within a week I heard back from them. During the interview they made you feel comfortable and it was decently laid back with mini conversations about random things. The people were very friendly and didnt ask very difficult questions that made you stop in tracks to double think about the answers.
Interview Questions: How could you implement our values and visons into your everday work

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Youth Opportunities Unlimited (Cleveland, OH) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had 5 interviews. There was a phone interview, two person interview. There was interview with HR and CEO. There was also a background check down, no shadowing opportunities due to program being new.

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Opportunities Unlimited
Interview Descriptions: After they received my resume and cover letter through idealist.org I was contacted for a phone interview. The phone interview was conducted by a member of staff and lasted about thirty minutes. Mostly, I think the interviewer was trying to gauge my personality and confirm my experience because they were hiring for a seasonal position for which they needed a lot of people.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with young people?

title: Director of Development and Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Youth Opportunities Unlimited (Cleveland, OH) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: One interview with the VP of Finance, who is also their HR person. We met in his office and talked for about 45 minutes. For a development job, it seemed very marketing-heavy, which the interviewer didn't seem to want to admit. He was very pleasant and said often how he enjoys doing interviews because it is an opportunity for him to meet people.
Interview Questions: What was a recent success you had in your job?
